description: The round payoff this round was 80. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 40.
This is a coordination game with elements of the Prisoner's Dilemma, where mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest total payoff
In the first round, both players chose option 1, suggesting initial cooperative behavior that maximized the total payoff
The game creates tension between cooperation and defection, as choosing option 2 when the other chooses option 1 gives a relative advantage to the defector
The repeated nature of the game allows for the development of trust or retaliation strategies based on previous rounds
So far, the interaction has been cooperative and optimal for both players
